definitions.definition: a word or set of words by which a person, animal, place, or thing is known, addressed, or referred to.
examples: my name is Parsons, John Parsons
as usual, the big race will lure the top names
synonyms: giant "the top names in the fashion industry"

definitions.definition: a reputation, especially a good one.
examples: he set up a school that gained a name for excellence
synonyms: distinction "the good name of the firm"

examples: hundreds of diseases had not yet been isolated or named
synonyms: christen; formaldenominate "they named the baby Phoebe"

definitions.definition: identify by name; give the correct name for.
examples: the dead man has been named as John Mackintosh
synonyms: specify "he named the woman in the photograph"

definitions.definition: give a particular title or epithet to.
examples: she was named “Artist of the Decade.”
the sea is as crystal clear as any spot in the Caribbean you might care to name

definitions.definition: appoint (someone) to a particular position or task.
examples: he was named to head a joint UN–OAS diplomatic effort

definitions.definition: specify (an amount, time, or place) as something desired, suggested, or decided on.
examples: he showed them the picture and named a price

definitions.definition: (of a person or commercial product) having a name that is widely known.
examples: countless specialized name brands geared to niche markets
